conclusion: To solve the problem, examine the v-t graph to determine the acceleration between 1 to 3 seconds.
The image shows a v-t graph with a horizontal line at v = 0 from t = 0 to 1, a line with a positive slope from t = 1 to 2, and a horizontal line at v = 0 from t = 2 to 3.
The problem asks for the acceleration during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds.
Acceleration is the derivative of velocity with respect to time, given by the slope of the v-t graph.
From t = 1 to 3, the graph has a horizontal line from t = 1 to 2, and a horizontal line from t = 2 to 3.
Both segments of the graph have zero slope, indicating constant velocity within these intervals.
Since the slope is zero between 1 and 3 seconds, the acceleration is also zero.
The acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is 0 m/sÂ².
